attributes.action: Bring the 1939 Cancer Act up to date
attributes.additional_details:
As someone with metastatic breast cancer, I have chosen to address the disease with a more natural approach rather than a chemical approach.

There are some aspects of my treatment that have been used to treat cancer successfully for over 100 years, are available in Scotland & are standard practice in Germany.

When treating cancer it is important to boost the immune system, improve gut health, address an individual’s emotional state, & follow and clean diet - none of these issues are addressed.
attributes.background:
The current cancer act is extremely out of date and excludes many treatments that help & support cancer patients through their cancer journey.

Whilst I admit there needs to be an act in place to protect vulnerable people from charlatans there also needs to be better access to natural treatments.

rejection.details: It's not clear what changes you want to be made to the Cancer Act 1939. Decisions about treatment offered to NHS patients are a matter for the NHS and individual clinicians, and not the UK Government or Parliament.
